title: All of you saying Darius doesn't need a heal
body:
If he didn't have a form of sustain/tankiness, he would be pre rework Darius all over again, in where he dies too soon to be able to get his damage off and is basically a low CC meat shield.

Now that he is able to survive and get his damage off, everybody hates him and wants his heal gone with the compensation being "higher Q damage!"

Listen for 5 seconds, if you gave Darius 1 million damage but he couldn't survive a teamfight for 2 seconds like pre rework because he had no way to survive outside items and base stats, he might as well have 20 damage as he can't get it off.

Is the heal a little strong? Probably, maybe needs a little toning down again(try 10% on each champion again if it is still strong)

Is his damage strong? Hell no, he deserves his damage if you allow him to get 5 stacks on you and don't peel him off in team fights.

Morde is the best example, if the team somehow manages to keep people still for Morde to hit them, it's a winning team.

I think most of the people here are forgetting that it's a percentage of his -MISSING HEALTH- and not a percentage of his max life. If Darius is trying to trade with you in lane, effing walk towards him, and if he walks further away then you just got a free card walking the other way and not taking any damage. If he goes towards you, woop de effing do you are in the half-damage range and he doesn't get the heal or even a stack of Hemmorhage. Let Darius keep his heal, 12% on a single target is nothing. I don't see anyone here complaining about Karma's Mantra W healing her for a good 20%, twice, with a scaling AP ratio, and snaring as well as dealing damage. Ya'll complain about Darius's Q in lane when you have to realize, it's far weaker than some other abilities out there.

Let's do a bit of comparisons.

At level 1, it deals a nice 20 + 50% total ad. With no AD runes, OH NO 50 DAMAGE! (If you are smart, you will try your best to dodge the blade, and if you don't try to dodge the blade you literally lost all rights of complaint.) Not to mention you even end up with only a measly 100 damage at level 1. I can think of several skills taken by top laners that deal over 100 damage. Renekton's W (90 damage plus 140% total attack damage, even more when empowered oh and it stuns and Renekton has no mana), or how about Rumble's Flamespitter, that casually hits for 39 every second when it is empowered (ignoring it's AP ratio of 50% every second) all at rank 1. Darius's Q doesn't even scale well early game compared to the other two, first of all Renekton's W gains flat damage per hit and scales on total AD so his base damage is always making it that much more powerful, and Rumble's Q just increases and increases in power way more than most other normal abilities in the game. Do I think Renekton and Rumble are op? Not really but they are good comparisons. Darius's Q just simple grows in a small bit of raw damage, and then more percentage of his AD as damage.

I'd type more here, as I have more points but I covered the largest thing people are complaining about, his Q. I'll leave a little TL;DR at the bottom for the exceptionally lazy.

Do I think Darius needs a nerf? Not really. He's fine as he is and I never have troubles with him until teamfight phase happens and I realize my team has nothing to stop him (low cc mostly melee as people have pointed out before)

TL;DR
Darius's Q is not super op, other champions have over-all better abilities that aren't even avoidable.

> [{quoted}](name=DogIsGod,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HfeFjcgr,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-09-23T19:11:00.520+0000)

> Yes, please.

To be more accurate, he would probably be WORSE than pre-rework Darius (albeit with a better lategame, but no real way of taking advantage of it since he'd just die too quickly).

Mostly due to the things he gave up in exchange for becoming what he is now; most notably the loss of damage on his Q, the delay it now has, the fixed pull, a good chunk of his dueling potential, as well as having the 6th worst AS in the entire game (well, its the 4th ~ 6th lowest, Jinx, Bard, and Darius actually have equal AS stats, Jinx raises hers through building AS though, as well as the steroid on her minigun)

To actually still compete without a heal, he'd need some pretty sizable buffs, at the very least he'd probably need his AS reverted to pre-rework Darius levels (allowing him to stack his passive on you faster; which would allow his passive to remain good in duels without him having a heal), maybe a buff to Q's damage as well.

I mean to be honest, you kind of need sustain to be a good melee champ (unless you have another way to avoid damage; but even then most people who do build sustain anyway, notably people like Fiora, Yi, Yasuo*; mostly Melee carries)

Bear in mind Darius isn't actually tanky comparatively, He doesn't have anything to help him tank damage in his kit; all he has is damage, damage and more damage, so to survive later on, he needs sustain (if he actually had something in his kit to help him survive better, that might not be the case, but we may never know; in that case I'd imagine he'd just build sustain anyway to help him tank longer); good comparison is Garen honestly, while he doesn't have sustain (in combat anyway); he has a skill that allows him to take greatly reduced damage for a duration.


*Note, Yasuo doesn't really prioritize sustain, but it is still built on him fairly often if the game goes on long enough.

TL;DR: Unless you have another way of avoiding damage (Yasuo, Riven, Fiora, Yi), or your inherently tanky (E.g: Wukong, Garen, Malphite, etc) you basically NEED sustain to function as a melee, its just the fact that your going to take a ton of damage just from being in melee range that causes this issue.
